intro: Tephrosia porrecta, commonly known as the slender tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom throughout the growing season. Tephrosia porrecta is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some cultures for medicinal purposes.
